dataset_names.description: List of dataset names. We have at most 5 class names in a single subset, which is why we have multiple bias_in_bios class subsets.
dataset_names.title: Dataset Names

context_length.description: The maximum length of each input to the LLM. Any longer inputs will be truncated, keeping only the beginning.
context_length.title: LLM Context Length

llm_batch_size.description: LLM batch size. This is set by default in the main script, or it can be set with a command line argument.
llm_batch_size.title: LLM Batch Size

llm_dtype.description: LLM data type. This is set by default in the main script, or it can be set with a command line argument.
llm_dtype.title: LLM Data Type

model_name.description: Model name. Must be set with a command line argument.
model_name.title: Model Name

k_values.description: K represents the number of SAE features or residual stream channels we train the linear probe on. We iterate over all values of K.
k_values.title: K Values

lower_vram_usage.description: Lower GPU memory usage by doing more computation on the CPU. Useful on 1M width SAEs. Will be slower and require more system memory.
lower_vram_usage.title: Lower Memory Usage

llm_test_accuracy.description: Linear probe accuracy when training on the full LLM residual stream
llm_test_accuracy.title: LLM Test Accuracy

llm_top_1_test_accuracy.title: LLM Top 1 Test Accuracy

llm_top_2_test_accuracy.title: LLM Top 2 Test Accuracy

llm_top_50_test_accuracy.title: LLM Top 50 Test Accuracy

llm_top_100_test_accuracy.title: LLM Top 100 Test Accuracy

description: An evaluation using SAEs to probe for supervised concepts in LLMs. We use sparse probing with the top K SAE latents and probe for over 30 different classes across 5 datasets.

eval_id.description: A unique UUID identifying this specific eval run
eval_id.title: ID

datetime_epoch_millis.description: The datetime of the evaluation in epoch milliseconds
datetime_epoch_millis.title: DateTime (epoch ms)

eval_result_metrics.description: The metrics of the evaluation, organized by category. Define your own categories and the metrics that go inside them.
eval_result_metrics.title: Result Metrics Categorized

eval_result_details.description: Each object is a stat on the sparse probing results for a dataset.
eval_result_details.title: Per-Dataset Sparse Probing Results

sae_bench_commit_hash.description: The commit hash of the SAE Bench that ran the evaluation.
sae_bench_commit_hash.title: SAE Bench Commit Hash

sae_lens_id.description: The ID of the SAE in SAE Lens.
sae_lens_id.title: SAE Lens ID

sae_lens_release_id.description: The release ID of the SAE in SAE Lens.
sae_lens_release_id.title: SAE Lens Release ID

sae_lens_version.description: The version of SAE Lens that ran the evaluation.
sae_lens_version.title: SAE Lens Version

sae_cfg_dict.description: The configuration of the SAE (custom or from SAE Lens) that ran the evaluation. This should match the SAE Lens config schema.
sae_cfg_dict.title: SAE Config Dict

eval_result_unstructured.description: Optional. Any additional outputs that don't fit into the structured eval_result_metrics or eval_result_details fields. Since these are unstructured, don't expect this to be easily renderable in UIs, or contain any titles or descriptions.
eval_result_unstructured.title: Unstructured Results

title: Sparse Probing
